1.comment: Brandon Lloyd 6 times for 124 yards and a touchdown. Good to see Lloyd is trying hard in his contract year. Never thought that would happen (rolls eyes).

2.comment: Brandon Lloyd caught 5 passes for 117 yards. Make sure you pick him up in fantasy; Orton really loves throwing to him. Meanwhile,

4.comment: Brandon Lloyd. Lloyd put on a monstrous performance, catching 6 balls for 169 yards and that score.

5.comment: Brandon Lloyd (11-115), Eddie Royal (8-113, TD), Jabar Gaffney (5-51) and Correll Buckhalter (5-38, TD).

6.comment: Brandon Lloyd caught both of Orton's touchdowns and finished with 5 grabs for 135 yards. He was second in the NFL in receiving yardage coming into this weekend, and it appears as though he'll be first come Tuesday. This is amazing because Lloyd was essentially out of the league prior to this season.    Without Knowshon Moreno, the Broncos predictably struggled to run the ball.

7.comment: Brandon Lloyd (4-74) and Eddie Royal (3-37) were the only other Broncos to catch passes.

8.comment: Brandon Lloyd notched just 1 catch for 46 yards. It came on Denver's final drive of the game.

9.comment: Brandon Lloyd notched 7 receptions for 169 yards and Orton's score.

10.comment: Brandon Lloyd early and often. Lloyd hauled in 6 balls for 90 yards and 2 touchdowns.

11.comment: Brandon Lloyd twice in the end zone; Lloyd had 4 grabs for 76 yards otherwise.

12.comment: Brandon Lloyd twice in the end zone; Lloyd had 4 grabs for 76 yards otherwise.

13.comment: Brandon Lloyd posted his usual awesome fantasy numbers (2-31).

14.comment: Brandon Lloyd on another terrific pass. Afterward, NFL Red Zone host Scott Hanson joked, I'm sure some expert said, 'Tim Tebow held the ball too low when he hit Brandon Lloyd for that touchdown.' The Broncos didn't ask Tebow to do much aerially though, as you can tell by those 16 attempts. Tebow ran numerous quarterback draws, churning out 78 rushing yards and a touchdown on the ground. Interim head coach Eric Studesville should feel more confident with Tebow going forward, so hopefully the Broncos don't baby him much longer.    Elsewhere on Denver's offense,

16.comment: Brandon Lloyd on a flea flicker that really fooled the Packers. When the Broncos had to move the ball down the field, they often had issues doing so.    Denver stated earlier in the week that it designed a few plays for Tebow. Well, Tebow had just 1 carry for minus-1 yard. He didn't attempt a pass. Expect more Te-Bow! chants in Denver against the Chargers on Sunday.

17.comment: Brandon Lloyd dropped a 2.point conversion attempt, making the game 26-24 with a couple of minutes remaining. San Diego had the ball on Denver's 40-yard line as the clock was ticking down. However, a phantom personal-foul penalty on Denver moved the Chargers into field goal range. With 20 seconds remaining,

18.comment: Brandon Lloyd off the team. Even when they could,

19.comment: Brandon Lloyd had 6 grabs for 74 yards. St. Louis finally has a legitimate No. 1 wideout for the first time since Torry Holt.

20.comment: Brandon Lloyd (6-53, TD). Feeley managed the game well, though he got away with an interception in the red zone, thanks to a

21.comment: Brandon Lloyd, who hauled in 5 grabs for 80 yards. Lloyd drew a key pass interference at the end of regulation to set up what should have been a

22.comment: Brandon Lloyd caught 4 balls for 48 yards and a touchdown, though he dropped a pass. Bradford's so used to that phenomenon that he probably didn't even notice. Still, it was a good performance for Lloyd considering that he was going up against Pro Bowl corner

23.comment: Brandon Lloyd caught 5 balls for 67 yards and a score. He and Bradford have only had about 7 practices together, so that chemistry will continue to improve. But that won't matter as long as Bradford is poorly protected in the pocket; he was sacked 5 times in this contest, thanks to the plethora of injuries to the tackle position.

24.comment: Brandon Lloyd had a better fantasy day, catching 5 balls for 74 yards and a touchdown. Despite Sam Bradford's struggles, Lloyd continues to produce.    Speaking of Bradford, St. Louis' coaching staff clearly didn't show any confidence in him, opening up the game with 5 consecutive runs, including 1 on a 3rd-and-9. Bradford once again wasn't very good but didn't have much of a chance behind his miserable offensive line, going 17-of-31 for 203 yards and the score to Lloyd.

25.comment: Brandon Lloyd on an acrobatic play, it looked like they might do something. Then Dashaun Goldson intercepted Feeley on an awful throw. San Francisco's offense decided to get creative on this series, handing the ball off to a wide receiver (

26.comment: Brandon Lloyd (3-29) as his leading receiver.

27.comment: Brandon Lloyd for a gain of 24 yards. Lloyd (6-100, TD) did what he could to wreck his former team. Then,

28.comment: Brandon Lloyd away for basically nothing, so Tim Tebow had to utilize bums like Matt Willis, who dropped a long completion on the final drive of this contest.

29.comment: Brandon Lloyd (5-69), but Lloyd stopped running for some reason. He had to leap for it awkwardly, looking like

30.comment: Brandon Lloyd (9-108). It was fairly obvious that the former would be reincorporated into the offense in the wake of Hernandez's injury. The other tight end,

31.comment: Brandon Lloyd on a number of throws to force incompletions. Gilmore helped set up Gronkowski's fumble by holding him up for Byrd. Gronkowski got open running deep down the field during the third quarter, but Gilmore blasted him as he crossed into the end zone to force an incompletion. It wasn't a complete game as Gilmore couldn't hold on for an acrobatic interception and was trucked over on a play in run defense. Still, it was an impressive performance for the rookie.    Fitzpatrick was 22-of-39 for 350 yards with 4 touchdowns and 4 interceptions. Stevie Johnson (2-23) saw double coverage, and Fitzpatrick missed him for an easy touchdown.

32.comment: Brandon Lloyd, meanwhile, had 6 grabs for 80 yards, but hurt his shoulder when he landed awkwardly out of bounds in the 4.h quarter.    The Patriots struggled to run the ball with

33.comment: Brandon Lloyd (2-28). Lloyd, battling a shoulder injury he suffered at Seattle, saw just 5 targets. He did draw 1 of Fletcher's pass interferences though.

34.comment: Brandon Lloyd (4-45) had a modest contribution. Edelman, meanwhile, was the play-maker for New England. He had a run of 47 yards, 5 receptions for 58 yards with a score, and his punt return for a touchdown.    Even though Talib had an uneven game, the Patriots have some real potential at cornerback with him and Dennard. They both have some man-to-man ability with ball skills. The duo has the capacity to be coached up and form a nice tandem come January when New England is attempting to get back to the Super Bowl.    The Colts clearly need a lot of work on defense. The front 7 had zero sacks, while the secondary was incapable of stopping anything. The defense definitely needs a lot of work before Indianapolis will be a team that is dangerous in January.

35.comment: Brandon Lloyd (3-26) disappointed yet again.    New England once again ran the ball very well.

36.comment: Brandon Lloyd (10-190) the most. Lloyd did a phenomenal job of working both sidelines.    Ed Hochuli might beat me up for saying this, but he did a poor job of officiating this game. There were some shaky calls, but the worst thing he did was cause a 15-minute delay when he was trying to figure out if

37.comment: Brandon Lloyd (10-190) the most. Lloyd did a phenomenal job of working both sidelines.    Ed Hochuli might beat me up for saying this, but he did a poor job of officiating this game. There were some shaky calls, but the worst thing he did was cause a 15-minute delay when he was trying to figure out if

38.comment: Brandon Lloyd (6-62) was just OK, but Aaron Hernandez killed his fantasy owners with just a 13-yard reception.

39.comment: Brandon Lloyd (3-76), Anquan Boldin (4-72), and Frank Gore (18-107) all chipped in to move the ball for San Francisco.

40.comment: Brandon Lloyd for a long score. That said, I was disappointed that he scrambled just 3 times (18 rushing yards). His legs are his best weapons, so he should use them more.    Kaepernick's sole touchdown went to Stevie Johnson, who actually led the team with 79 receiving yards off 5 catches. Boldin (7-50) was solid outside of the dropped score, but Crabtree (4-27) and Davis (2-21) both had awful outings.    The Broncos did a great job of shutting down the run.
